term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - spin-statistical factor (in diffusion-controlled reactions)
term.title: spin-statistical factor

item.text: From the possible encounter pairs between states of different spin multiplicity, only those conserving multiplicity in going to products are expected to react.

notes.item: This factor determines the efficiency of diffusion-controlled reactions, which have an encounter-controlled rate. Typical examples are quenching of fluorescence of aromatic hydrocarbons by O2, quenching of triplet states by O2, and tripletâ€“triplet annihilation (in radiochemistry, in photochemistry).

sources.item: PAC, 2007, 79, 293. 'Glossary of terms used in photochemistry, 3rd edition (IUPAC Recommendations 2006)' on page 428 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac200779030293)

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
